responses.actionPlans:
The score of 3 out of 7 for Law Enforcement Alliance indicates that there is room to grow when it comes to gun safety and readiness. To ensure a safe and secure school environment, action plans should be proposed for improvement in the following areas: 

• Increase the personnel trained in threat and risk assessments and evaluations. 
• Create, maintain, and update emergency and incident response plans. 
• Promote collaboration between all members of the school safety committee. 
• Develop procedures to identify and respond to threats of violence or behavior that may endanger the safety of students and staff.
• Develop a comprehensive plan to monitor access to areas of the school to which students and staff do not typically have access.
• Create and maintain a list of community resources that can be quickly accessed to assist staff and students in the event of an emergency. 
• Foster a reporting environment where staff and students can voice concerns and recognize concerning behavior.

Overall, increasing law enforcement alliance

3 out of 7 possible scores is not considered good for school safety readiness. In order to improve its Facility Exterior and gun safety readiness, the school should begin to implement the following action plans:

• Improve exterior facility security monitoring, such as adding exterior security cameras covering blind spots and motion sensor lighting.
• Increase visibility of school entrances by redesigning the area and placing fencing and/or wall barriers around property.
• Establish and enforce a “no guns allowed” policy strictly to all students and visitors entering the school.
• Educate students, staff and parents on safe usage and storage of guns and provide gun safety training resources.
• Develop an emergency protocol for response to gun violence emergencies, including crisis management training for staff and law enforcement.
• Regularly conduct drills, such as Active Shooter drills, to ensure staff and students are aware of the protocol and better prepared in the case of an actual emergency.
• Monitor the usage of school grounds

Six out of seven possible scores is relatively good for a school trying to improve its School Details + Demographics and improve gun safety readiness. However, there is room for improvement. The following action plans can help a school move closer towards its goal:

• Take an inventory of the school, documenting problems related to School Details + Demographics that may have been causing security issues. Utilize the feedback from students, staff, and community members to make improvements. 

• Use the results of the inventory to design a comprehensive gun safety program that can address issues on both the school and the community level. 

• Reach out to local law enforcement to evaluate current gun safety measures at the school. Include the recommendations of law enforcement officials in the gun safety program. 

• Create a gun safety task force to make sure the gun safety program is implemented successfully and any issues are addressed quickly. 

• Provide gun safety education and training to staff and faculty.

Four out of seven possible scores is not a great score for a school looking to improve its facility interior and gun safety readiness. To improve, the following action plans should be implemented:

• Establish a clear protocol for handling firearms and accessing ammunition to ensure the proper security measures are in place to minimize threats or violations of school policy.

• Make sure the facility interior is up-to-date with modern security systems and technology, such as metal detectors and alarm systems, and receive proper maintenance.

• Work in collaboration with the community and local law enforcement to create an effective plan to secure the interior of the school.

• Establish clear emergency protocols to ensure that students and faculty are properly protected in case of emergencies.

• Train school staff and faculty in gun safety and emergency response procedures.

• Invest in mental health and counseling services for students that may need intervention or support during unanticipated crises.
